summary: All Round 1 fixes verified as adequate. No new maintainability issues introduced.

M2_magic_number_50.fix: Added NEW_STORIES_DISPLAY_LIMIT constant with clear comment explaining its purpose
M2_magic_number_50.assessment: Excellent. Constant is named descriptively and includes rationale comment

M3_generic_function_name.assessment: Much better. New name explicitly describes the filtering behavior (by timestamp, not by run completion)

M4_missing_docstring.fix: Added comprehensive docstring for validate_iso_timestamp with Args, Returns, and Raises sections
M4_missing_docstring.assessment: Thorough. Docstring clearly explains purpose, format expectations, and error cases

positive_observations.observation: Inline comment at line 79-80 explains timestamp filtering caveat
positive_observations.impact: Prevents future confusion about when stories are filtered (run start vs completion)
Complex polling/selection behavior is now documented inline

positive_observations.observation: Test coverage expanded for timestamp validation
positive_observations.impact: Security fix (S1) has comprehensive test coverage including edge cases

code_review_notes.future_maintainer_experience: Good. Next developer can understand timestamp filtering logic and display limits without hunting through code or git history.
